metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2483 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
crypt_blowfish before 1.1, as used in PHP before 5.3.7 on certain platforms, PostgreSQL before 8.4.9, and other products, does not properly handle 8-bit characters, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to determine a cleartext password by leveraging knowledge of a password hash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2483` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

john - 1.7.8-1
john-data - 1.7.8-1
No subscription required

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
libphp5-embed - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php-pear - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5 - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-cgi - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-cli - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-common - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-curl - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-enchant - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-fpm - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-gd - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-gmp - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-intl - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-ldap - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-mysql - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-mysqlnd - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-odbc - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-pgsql - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-pspell - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-readline - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-recode - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-snmp - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-sqlite - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-sybase - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-tidy - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-xmlrpc - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
php5-xsl - 5.3.6-13ubuntu2
No subscription required

postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1~rc1-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> libcrypt-eksblowfish-perl not affected per Debian (fixed in 2007) see redhat bug on php5 patches. A regression was introduced in 5.3.7 postgresql needs more than upstream patch mdeslaur> setting john priority to low, since it's not really a security issue, and Ubuntu doesn't use blowfish hashes.

criterions.comment: john package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.8-1').
php5 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.6-13ubuntu2').
postgresql-9.1 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1~rc1-2').
